page.title: 19"LIVE AID" POTT SHRIGLEY.
page.content: The 1985 Live Aid Concert was the idea of the leader of a popular music group whose concern for the drought induced starvation of the people of war torn Etheopia was moved to action He inspired many famous "Pop Groups" to give charity concerts in London and America these were televised world wide. Millions paid to attend or sent donations and Â£45,000,000.was raised in one day of global altruism. A local man arranged the "Pott" screening on a giant screen set up in a hilltop field despite panic forcasts of vandalism due to drugs and drink as had been the case at some concerts. The fears were groundless, but many were dissuaded by adverse puplicity & the bus company refused to provide extra transport,so only 6,000 folk ventured out for a peaceful, pleasurable day, the police on duty relaxing & joining in the fun.
